intro: Coprosma montana var. typica, commonly known as the mountain coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and montane regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for native birds. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for landscaping in suitable climates.
